abstract.simpara: PHP, which stands for "PHP: Hypertext Preprocessor", is an HTML-embedded scripting language. Much of its syntax is borrowed from C, Java and Perl with some unique features thrown in. The goal of the language is to allow web developers to write dynamically generated pages quickly.

sect1.title: About this Manual
sect1.para: This manual is written in XML using the DocBook XML DTD, using DSSSL (Document Style and Semantics Specification Language) for formatting. The tools used for formatting HTML, TeX and RTF versions are Jade, written by James Clark and The Modular DocBook Stylesheets written by Norman Walsh. PHP's documentation framework is maintained by &link.stig;.
You can download the manual in various languages and formats, including PDF, plain text, plain HTML, WinHelp, and RTF from &url.php.docs;.
Daily HTML snapshots of the manual, including translations, can be found at &url.php.snaps.manual;.
You can find more information about downloading the XML source code of this documentation at &url.php.cvs;. The documentation is stored in the phpweb module.
